column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=In London , as with most communities in Ontario , the three most important issues to voters will be health care , health care , and health care .
#Text=I agree that health care is important , but it ca n't be addressed in isolation .
#Text=We need to make sure we have enough doctors .
#Text=We must also provide doctors with support from other health care professionals .
#Text=We must address quality of life issues for health care workers , and the populace at large .
#Text=We must clean up our air , water and soil .
#Text=We must produce our food locally .

#Text=We must plan our communities to encourage walking and transit use ( more exercise means less obesity , heart disease , diabetes , and more transit means less air pollution and fewer respirator illnesses ) .
#Text=We must discourage sprawl .
#Text=We must address poverty .
#Text=We must provide shelter .
#Text=To look at any one issue in isolation misses the point : our society is interconnected , and our government policy should be , too .
#Text=The main issues that concern me are sprawl , climate change , and peak oil .

#Text=Once again , these issues are interconnected , they all feed one another , and we must address all of them together : better planned communities means less commuting , lower GHG emissions , and more time before we run out of fossil fuels .
#Text=It also means a healthier community , and a closer , healthier food supply , etc.
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Preparing for the coming energy crisis .
#Text=Conservation must be our watchword .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?

#Text=Currently , no , because existing taxpayers must not only pay for services , but must also subsidize new development , expanded infrastructure , and repairing our existing infrastructure , in addition to providing a whole host of services downloaded by the previous government and not yet uploaded .
#Text=And since property taxes are really the only way municipalities can raise funds , they must continually increase to cover costs .
#Text=However , uploading services in some way only reduces a municipal tax to replace it with a provincial one , so the taxpayer does n't see it as plainly , but still pays it .
#Text=We must allow municipalities to stop subsidizing new development , and develop new revenue streams ot cover costs , while we upload some services to give them a little wiggle room .
#Text=Municipalities must be able to choose their destinies .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=What we do currently , propping up failing industries , is a short term solution .
#Text=Investing in sustainable industries : green power , green manufacturing , manufacturing based on renewable resources , sustainable farming , will go much farther .
#Text=So will encouraging more local economies .
#Text=Our global economy is remarkable centralized .
#Text=A part is made here , another in Kentucky , and another in Hokkaido .
#Text=The whole thing is assembled in Michigan .
#Text=This means fewer jobs .

#Text=But if things were built locally , and designed locally , and sold locally , and repaired locally , and recycled locally , then we would have a much more vibrant , interesting , sustainable and flexible economy .
#Text=That means more jobs .
